title: ICE on recursive fn which returns impl T

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-beta
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to beta.

labels.name: A-impl-trait
labels.description: Area: impl Trait. Universally / existentially quantified anonymous types with static dispatch.

body:
Valid according to stable (1.64.0), but ICEs beta (1.65.0-beta.4) and [ICEs nightly](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=cc86e5d371c37ed9015ebdcee4429653): ```rust trait T {} fn wrap(x: impl T) -> impl T { wrap(wrap(x)) } fn main() {} ``` Reduced from a [fuzzer](https://github.com/jruderman/fuzz-rustc) mutation of [src/test/ui/impl-trait/issue-87450.rs](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/0a6b941df354c59b546ec4c0d27f2b9b0cb1162c/src/test/ui/impl-trait/issue-87450.rs) ### Error output Two ICEs: ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !infcx.is_in_snapshot() || self.usable_in_snapshot', compiler/rustc_trait_selection/src/traits/fulfill.rs:177:9 error: internal compiler error: no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued error: internal compiler error: VecMap([(OpaqueTypeKey { def_id: DefId(0:7 ~ main[d88a]::wrap::{opaque#1}), substs: [impl T] }, OpaqueTypeDecl { hidden_type: OpaqueHiddenType { span: cyz/src/main.rs:7:5: 7:18 (#0), ty: impl T }, origin: FnReturn(DefId(0:4 ~ main[d88a]::wrap)) })]) | = note: delayed at compiler/rustc_infer/src/infer/opaque_types/table.rs:50:26 ```
Full output with both backtraces

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !infcx.is_in_snapshot() || self.usable_in_snapshot', compiler/rustc_trait_selection/src/traits/fulfill.rs:177:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x105c92882 - ::fmt::h25d806a113d8ecc4 1: 0x105cea72a - Abort trap: 6 ```

### Version `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.66.0-nightly (bed4ad65b 2022-10-25) binary: rustc commit-hash: bed4ad65bf7a1cef39e3d66b3670189581b3b073 commit-date: 2022-10-25 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.66.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.2 ``` ### Regression Bisected with cargo-bisect-rustc on x86_64-apple-darwin: searched nightlies: from nightly-2022-08-23 to nightly-2022-10-26 regressed nightly: nightly-2022-08-31 searched commit range: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/compare/bc4b39c271bbd36736cbf1c0a1ac23d5df38d365...02654a0844f5c8d29bac318c3c6c666da3d8543d regressed commit: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/0631ea5d73f4a3199c776687b12c20c50a91f0d2 (rollup) Among the commits in the rollup, my guess is #100092 (CC @compiler-errors): * It added the function `relate_opaques` (frame 19 on the first stack). * It [added a regression test](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/100092/files#diff-631962fa04bbed4d21ca7fa07e1a2b640e9a90218ec4868f2ff54caecae04caf) with some similarities: an unconditionally recursive function with `impl` in return position. @rustbot label +regression-from-stable-to-beta +A-impl-trait
